intro: Sisymbrium bellidifolium, commonly known as the bellidifolium mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces yellow or white flowers that bloom in late spring. Sisymbrium bellidifolium is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
